materials.raw_text: B: 6 g, Co: 6 g, Fe: 8 g, Tm: 4 g (Total: 24 g)

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply store; Co (Cobalt powder) - Metal suppliers; Fe (Iron powder) - Metal suppliers; Tm (Thulium powder) - Rare earth metal suppliers.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply store; Co (Cobalt powder) - Metal suppliers; Fe (Iron powder) - Metal suppliers; Tm (Thulium powder) - Rare earth metal suppliers.

1. Measure out 6 g of Boron powder, 6 g of Cobalt powder, 8 g of Iron powder, and 4 g of Thulium powder using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the powders thoroughly using a spatula for even distribution. 3. Transfer the mixed powders into a ball mill for 30 minutes to achieve a fine homogeneous mixture.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 6 g of Boron powder, 6 g of Cobalt powder, 8 g of Iron powder, and 4 g of Thulium powder using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the powders thoroughly using a spatula for even distribution. 3. Transfer the mixed powders into a ball mill for 30 minutes to achieve a fine homogeneous mixture.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the powder mixture in a ceramic crucible and insert it into the preheated furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the powder mixture in a ceramic crucible and insert it into the preheated furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the compound.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door during cooling to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door during cooling to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Grind the solid sample to achieve the desired surface finish. 3. If required, seal the sample with a protective coating to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Grind the solid sample to achieve the desired surface finish. 3. If required, seal the sample with a protective coating to enhance durability.
